clinical_study.brief_title: A Parenting and Self-Care Intervention for HIV Infected Mothers
clinical_study.official_title: A Parenting Intervention for HIV+ Moms: The IMAGE Program

brief_summary.textblock: The IMAGE intervention was developed to improve parenting and self-care skills in mothers infected with HIV. It is expected that an improvement in these areas will in turn improve the mother's physical and mental health as well as the child's mental health and behavioral adjustment.

detailed_description.textblock: Worldwide, close to half the adults living with HIV are women and a large proportion of these women are of child-bearing age. Whereas anyone living with HIV faces the physical challenges of living with a chronic disease, as well as the material and social impact of the stigma associated with the disease, mothers living with HIV must also meet the demands of childrearing while mitigating the negative impact of the disease upon their family. Mothers with HIV report that this is their greatest source of stress. Moreover, children of these mothers, growing up with a parent with a chronic, stigmatized, and often fatal disease, are considered a high-risk group. The IMAGE intervention was designed to improve parenting and self-care skills in mothers with HIV in order to improve the mother's physical and mental health as well as the child's mental health and behavioral adjustment.

primary_outcome.measure: Targeted Behaviors, Practices, and Skills and Maternal and Child Health
primary_outcome.description: Specific targets of the intervention, including parenting practices, parenting behaviors, and self care skills, will be evaluated. In addition, the mother's physical and mental health and the child's mental health and behavioral adjustment will be evaluated.

secondary_outcome.description: Perceptions of effectiveness in the parental role and general parenting self-efficacy will be assessed.

arm_group.description: mothers are provided the IMAGE Parenting and Self-Care intervention

intervention.description: Mothers in the intervention will receive four individual intervention sessions with a facilitator. The sessions will cover parenting and self care skills.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- mother has confirmed diagnosis of HIV
- well (HIV-) child, 6 to 14 years of age
- mother is English or Spanish speaking
- child is English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- low cognitive/intellectual functioning (<75) in mother or child
- psychosis in mother or child

results_reference.citation: Murphy DA, Armistead L, Payne DL, Marelich WD, Herbeck DM. Pilot trial of a parenting and self-care intervention for HIV-positive mothers: the IMAGE program. AIDS Care. 2017 Jan;29(1):40-48. Epub 2016 Jul 4.
